newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan to fence border with India.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan to fence border with India.

text.p: Pakistan said on Monday it would fence its border with India to check an "increasing illegal immigration".
The proposal to check illegal immigration was approved by a meeting of Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto's cabinet on Monday, an official statement said.

"The cabinet decided that, in addition to fortifying and reinforcing measures already in force for the purpose, fencing of the border area will also be taken in hand under a phased programme, starting with (the southern province of) Sindh," it said, without giving details.
India has already built a barbed wire fence along the border of its troubled Punjab state with Pakistan's Punjab province.
India has been accusing Pakistan of helping a Sikh separatist movement in Punjab state while Islamabad has often accused New Delhi of sponsoring violence in the Sindh capital of Karachi.
Karachi's population of about 12 million is dominated by Urdu-speaking Moslems who migrated from India at Partition in 1947 and their descendants.

Pakistan has objected to India's plans to extend its Punjab state fence to a tense military control line in the disputed Kashmir region, where New Delhi is fighting a Moslem separatist revolt since 1990.
